encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: The Cache Key (identifier) for this entry (required)
Max. entry age in seconds (optional if a default value exists)

stringValue.value: Looks Up an item associated with key: cacheKey in cache with ID: cacheID and returns it in values, if the item exists.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: The Cache Key (identifier) for this entry (required)
Max. number of entries for this cache (optional if a default value exists)
Max. entry age in seconds (optional if a default value exists)
Max. size for each entry (optional if a default value exists)
The message to be cached (required, must exist in the preceeding policy context)

stringValue.value: Writes an item to cache with ID: cacheID with key: cacheKey.  If the cache does not exist, one will be created.  If the key exists, the existing item will be overwritten.
This assertion returns an error message, http status and content-type value associated with the given 'Error code'.

A value combined with the given error code. If, for example, an API would be identifiedby the values '1234' and the given error code is '111' the exported variable 'error.code' would contain '1234111'
A value associated with a certain error. If that value is unkown it will be replaced with '000' within the output variable 'error.code'

Requires a request to use SSL and optionally present a client certificate. It is not authenticating the client, just requiring its certificate.
                    Use this encapsulated assertion at the beginning of the API policy. Preced 'OTK FIP Client Authentication' with this assertion.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: Success: Add additional values that may be displayed for login or consent

stringValue.value: Provides variables used to generate the authorization servers website. It references 'resource_owner', 'scope', 'client_name' and 'sessionID', 'host_login_server', 'path_login_server', 'host_consent_server', 'path_consent_server' implicitly.
This variable contains the HTML page for success messages
This variable contains the HTML page for error messages
Exports variables that contain OTK configurations that are related to the persistence layer

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: The Cache Key (identifier) for this entry (required)
Max. number of entries for this cache (optional if a default value exists)
Max. entry age in seconds (optional if a default value exists)
Max. size for each entry (optional if a default value exists)

stringValue.value: Removes an item with key: cacheKey from cache with ID:  cacheID
Modifies the session database table depending on the input parameters. This encas should not be used directly. Use the corresponding encas found at the 'manage/session' folder.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: Name of cache to be used

stringValue.value: Retrieve session values from the database. The result has to be URL decoded.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: Name of cache to be used

stringValue.value: Creates a new session or updates a matching existing one. Use this for temporary values.

Retrieves all id_token values from the persistence layer. The following parameters are valid in combination:
                    (resource_owner, azp), (sub, azp), (jwt)

Retrieves values for an id_token. Depending on the configuration the values will be looked up via local database using using 'OTK id_token DB Lookup' or via routing assertion to an endpoint that implements the database access. The following parameters are valid in combination: (resource_owner, azp), (sub, azp), (jwt).
Validates a given id_token. If 'check expiration' is set to 'false' the expiration date will only be exported but not validated.
Look up attributes for a given username.

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: Prompt type for reauthentication and consent

stringValue.value: Authenticates users through different means. It authenticates users against the configured IDP
This value will only be respected if 'Username' is empty
The name of the cookie that should be found in the value of 'Cookie-Header'. This value will only be respected if 'Username' is empty
By default a SiteMinder SSO token (not the SMSESSION cookie) used to re-authenticate a user. This is for MAG installations only

encapsulatedAssertionArgument.guiLabel: Name of cache to be used
Maximum age for Cache in seconds as it was created

stringValue.value: Deletes a session from the session store database.
